result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam C Berg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the department feels that probation should be terminated early, then the department may petition for early termination.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.

Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including a psychological evaluation. No violent contact with mother. May not have contact with father unless approved by the agent and father. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam C Berg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Adam C Berg in court with attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Marilyn Leedle.
State has extended an offer.
Def is requesting an adjournment.
Def would like time to do more investigation work.
BTC: Adjournment granted.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 2, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No violent contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Adam C Berg in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
